alert.note: Alert for McKean; Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 12:42PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF WARREN AND MCKEAN COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1231 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Randolph and Frewsburg New York to 5 miles north of Sugar Grove and Bear Lake and moving southeast at 35 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Russell around 1250 PM EST. Warren, Bradford and Warren South around 1255 PM EST. Youngsville and Scandia around 100 PM EST. Marshburg around 105 PM EST. Garland, Rew and Kinzua Dam around 110 PM EST. Chapman State Park around 115 PM EST. This snow squall will impact State Route 6 and Route 219 over the next hour. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Delay travel or get off the road as you see the snow squall approaching. You`ll notice snow-obscured hills or wooded areas off in the distance from the squall. If you can`t exit the road in time and you`re entering the squall, use your emergency flashers as you slow down to help gradually slow traffic behind you and prevent high speed collisions at the onset of the squall. &&
